doc.after: By looking at a speedometer, one can read the speed of a car at any instant, or its instantaneous speed.[3] A car travelling at 50Â km/h generally goes for less than one hour at a constant speed, but if it did go at that speed for a full hour, it would travel 50Â km. If the vehicle continued at that speed for half an hour, it would cover half that distance (25Â km). If it continued for only one minute, it would cover about 833Â m.
